xtiny-doc-page.title: Editor
xtiny-doc-page.paragraph: The Jext text area is familiar to anyone who is used to a modern text editor. To add text, simply click in the area and enter your desired text. Beyond this basic usage, the Jext text area has many other useful features which are described below.

A right click in the text area will open the text area's popup menu. The popup menu contains many items from the Edit menu as well as others such as Search and Tools. Using the popup menu can increase your productivity.
As a matter of fact, Jext's text area accepts several key shortcuts which will greatly help you in writing your text. Shortcuts make selecting and moving text easier. Here is a list of them:

menu.item: Indents the selected block of code.
De-indents selected block.
Scrolls up the text view by one line without changing the caret position relative to the text.
Scrolls down the text view by one line without changing the caret position relative to the text.
Scrolls up the text view by one page without changing the caret position relative to the text.
Scrolls down the text view by one page without changing the caret position relative to the text.
Goes to the previous line, if one exists, starting at the first non-whitespace character.
Goes to the next line, if one exists, starting at the first non-whitespace character.
Jumps to the beginning of previous word. A word can be delimited by whitespace as well as by other symbols like braces, dots, etc...
Jumps to beginning of the next word.
Selects up to beginning/end of a word.
Acts as C+LEFT|RIGHT but this action is case sensitive. If a word contains capitalized letters, this shortcut will use them as separators. Very useful in programming.
Case sensitive word selection.
Deletes next word.
Deletes previous word.
Deletes previous word, case sensitive.
Deletes next word, case sensitive.

Switches between insert and replace modes. Insert mode is the default. While in replace mode, each character typed will overwrite the one under or above the caret (depending on which caret, block or line respectively, you choose).

Goes to beginning of the current line. If Smart HOME/END option is activated, pressing this key twice will place your caret at the top of the visible text and pressing it three times will place your caret at the beginning of the document.
Jumps to the beginning of the document.

Jumps to the end of the current line. If Smart HOME/END option is activated, pressing this key twice will place your caret to the bottom of the visible text and pressing it three times will place your caret at the end of the document.
Jumps to the end of the document.
Browses through opened document to the right.
Browses through opened document to the left.

Selects a part of the text. Each S+LEFT or S+RIGHT press will select the next character whereas S+DOWN and S+UP will include part of an adjacent line. This can be combined with the C key. For instance, SC+LEFT will select the previous word.
Move the mouse while holding those keys down to make a rectangular selection.
Moves the selected text from one place to another.
Copies the selected text from one place to another.

xtiny-doc-page.paragraph: The standard Jext distribution comes with a plugin called HyperTyper. This plugin helps you to save lots of time and typing. It is very easy to use: you define an abbreviation which stands for a string of text, type the shorthand sequence (the abbreviation), press ESCAPE (this expansion key can be changed in plugins options) and automagically, HyperTyper expands the shorthand sequence into the text you've defined. The defaults are mainly designed for Java programmers, but because HyperTyper is so flexible, it's suitable to whatever line of work you're in. To add/remove/edit shorthands, click on Plugins-HyperTyper-Manager Window. Transient abbreviations are lost when Jext is closed whereas persistent ones will be available in the next session.

To add a new sequence, simply select some text to be stored as expanded text and press C+F5 (or click on Plugins-HyperTyper-Create Sequence). A new window appears which allows you to modify the selected text, to choose the type of the abbreviation (transient or persistent), and to give it an abbreviation.

Along the left of the text area, you can see a thin grey line which indicates the gutter is present. Double-clicking it or clicking then dragging it will show it. The gutter offers line numbering of the text area and highlights line numbers every 5 lines. The gutter can be customized in the options menu.
